so inhale there are six agents also can you give me a breakdown on all the agents in how what they use how they use it their files that they use and just a general what the agent does and any other things that are relevant for that particular agent make it detail and report
entries.assistant:
I'll explore the HAL codebase to understand all the agents and provide a detailed breakdown. Let me start by investigating the agent system.Now let me get some additional details by reading the key files directly to ensure I have the complete picture.Now let me read the base agent class and the orchestrator to complete the picture.Now I have all the information needed. Let me create a comprehensive report on all the agents in HAL.I've created a comprehensive interactive report. Here's a detailed summary of all **6 agents** in the HAL system:

---

## HAL Agent System - Complete Breakdown

### Overview
The HAL system has **6 active agents** (with 7 registered types since `cargo_group` has an alias `risk_modifier`):
- **4 Database-Driven Agents** - Rule-based, deterministic calculations from DB tables
- **2 AI-Powered Agents** - Azure OpenAI integration for intelligent analysis

---

## Agent Details

### 1. Rating Agent (Priority: 10)
| Aspect | Details |
|--------|---------|
| **Type** | Database-driven |
| **File** | `src/agents/implementations/rating.ts` (169 lines) |
| **Purpose** | Calculates base insurance rate from sum insured bands |
| **Tables Used** | `SumInsuredRateBand` |
| **Output** | `baseRate` (percentage), `bandNumber`, `includesWSRCC` |
| **Confidence** | 95% (direct match), 85% (fallback) |

---

### 2. Cargo Group Agent (Priority: 20)
| Aspect | Details |
|--------|---------|
| **Type** | Database-driven |
| **File** | `src/agents/implementations/cargo-group.ts` (341 lines) |
| **Purpose** | Determines cargo classification and rate loading multiplier |
| **Tables Used** | `CargoGroup`, `HSCode`, `HSChapter` |
| **Output** | `rateLoadingMultiplier`, `cargoGroupNumber`, `minExcess`, `minPremium` |
| **Matching Strategy** | 4-level fallback: HS commodity (98%) → Pattern (92%) → Chapter (80%) → Default (60%) |

---

### 3. Geography Agent (Priority: 30)
| Aspect | Details |
|--------|---------|
| **Type** | Database-driven |
| **File** | `src/agents/implementations/geography.ts` (360 lines) |
| **Purpose** | Calculates geographic risk loading based on voyage route |
| **Tables Used** | `Country`, `InternationalRiskGroup`, `CountryRiskAssignment`, `DomesticVoyageLoading` |
| **Output** | `geographyLoadingMultiplier`, `isDomestic`, `loadingBreakdown` |
| **Logic** | Domestic (AU/NZ) uses DomesticVoyageLoading; International uses MAX of origin/destination risk groups |

---

### 4. Claims History Agent (Priority: 40)
| Aspect | Details |
|--------|---------|
| **Type** | Database-driven |
| **File** | `src/agents/implementations/claims-history.ts` (332 lines) |
| **Purpose** | Calculates claims experience loading from historical loss ratio |
| **Tables Used** | `ClaimsExperienceLoading` |
| **Output** | `claimsLoadingMultiplier`, `credibilityFactor`, `lossRatioPercent` |
| **Special** | Credibility weighting: 60% years-of-history + 40% premium volume; Full credibility at 5+ years & $500k+ |

---

### 5. Market Intelligence Agent (Priority: 50)
| Aspect | Details |
|--------|---------|
| **Type** | AI-Powered (Azure OpenAI) |
| **Files** | `src/agents/implementations/market-intelligence.ts` (167 lines), `ai-base.ts` (340 lines) |
| **Purpose** | Analyzes market conditions, cargo vulnerabilities, route risks |
| **Services** | Azure OpenAI, AI Cache (`src/services/openai.ts`, `src/services/ai-cache.ts`) |
| **Output** | `marketLoadingMultiplier` (-20% to +50%), `marketCondition`, `opportunityScore`, `riskFactors` |
| **Analysis Factors** | Piracy, weather, congestion, theft/damage/spoilage, soft/hard market, seasonal patterns |

---

### 6. Arbiter Agent (Priority: 100 - Last)
| Aspect | Details |
|--------|---------|
| **Type** | AI-Powered Final Decision |
| **File** | `src/agents/implementations/arbiter.ts` (234 lines) |
| **Purpose** | Synthesizes all agent outputs into final pricing recommendation |
| **Output** | `arbiterLoadingMultiplier` (±5% max), `finalRecommendedRate`, `profitabilityScore`, `competitivenessScore`, `riskScore` |
| **Decisions** | APPROVED, APPROVED_WITH_ADJUSTMENTS, REQUIRES_REFERRAL, DECLINED |
| **Referral Triggers** | Any confidence < 60%, loadings > 50%, premium > $50k, agent conflicts |

---

## Core Infrastructure Files

| File | Lines | Purpose |
|------|-------|---------|
| `src/agents/types.ts` | 323 | Type definitions (AgentType, AgentDecision, PricingResult, IAgent) |
| `src/agents/base.ts` | 525 | Abstract BaseAgent with retry logic, timeout handling, event publishing |
| `src/agents/factory.ts` | 347 | Singleton factory for agent creation, caching, hot-reload |
| `src/agents/orchestrator.ts` | 630 | Multi-agent orchestration with parallel execution by priority |
| `src/agents/implementations/index.ts` | 49 | Agent registration (maps types to implementations) |

---

## Execution Flow
```
API Request → Load Agents by Priority → Execute in Parallel Groups:
  Priority 10: RatingAgent (base rate)
  Priority 20: CargoGroupAgent (loading)
  Priority 30: GeographyAgent (loading)  
  Priority 40: ClaimsHistoryAgent (loading)
  Priority 50: MarketIntelligenceAgent (AI adjustment)
  Priority 100: ArbiterAgent (final decision)
→ Aggregate: baseRate × all multipliers → Store & Return
```

---

**View the interactive report:** [http://127.0.0.1:8800/hal-agents-report.html](http://127.0.0.1:8800/hal-agents-report.html)
